generif.text: Study investigated the expression pattern of the GSDM family genes in the upper gastrointestinal epithelium and cancers.
caspase-1 and caspase-4/5/11 specifically cleaved the linker between the amino-terminal gasdermin-N and carboxy-terminal gasdermin-C domains in GSDMD, which was required and sufficient for pyroptosis
Gene deletion of GSDMD demonstrated that GSDMD is required for pyroptosis and for the secretion but not proteolytic maturation of IL-1beta in both canonical and non-canonical inflammasome responses.
GsdmD p30 kills cells by forming pores that compromise the integrity of the cell membrane.
GSDMD N-terminal cleavage product oligomerizes in membranes to form pores that are visible by electron microscopy
Overall, these data demonstrate that GSDMD is the direct and final executor of pyroptotic cell death.
Studies show that the membrane-pores composed of gasdermin D-N domains (GSDMD-N domain) are required for pyroptosis.
the gasdermin-D pore: Executor of pyroptotic cell death
This study reveals the pore-forming activity of GSDMD and channel-forming activity of MLKL determine different ways of plasma membrane rupture in pyroptosis and necroptosis.
Studies indicate that gasdermin D (GSDMD) is cleaved by the activated caspases-1/4/5/11 between its N-terminal and C-terminal domains.
The pyroptosis is redefined as gasdermin D-mediated programmed necrosis. Gasdermin D are associated with various genetic diseases, and their cellular function and mechanism of activation.
Remarkably, the Enterovirus 71 protease 3C directly targets GSDMD and induces its cleavage, which is dependent on the protease activity.

Data, including data from studies using recombinant fusion forms of GSDMD, suggest that GSDMD participates in inflammasome-dependent pyroptosis of macrophages in response to various stimuli; this mechanism involves proteolysis of GSDMD by caspase-1 and caspase-11.
These findings reveal that GSDMD-C acts as an auto-inhibition executor and GSDMD-N could form pore structures via a charge-charge interaction upon cleavage by caspases during cell pyroptosis.
Results implicate pyroptosis induced by the CASP11/4-GSDMD pathway in the pathogenesis of alcoholic hepatitis

Pyroptosis regulator gasdermin D was necessary for IL-1beta secretion from living macrophages that have been exposed to inflammasome activators, such as bacteria and their products or host-derived oxidized lipids

Gasdermin D plays a key role in the pathogenesis of non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) by regulating lipogenesis, the inflammatory response, and the NF-kB signaling pathway, revealing potential treatment targets for NASH in humans.
GSDMD regulates the release of microparticulate active caspase 1 from monocytes essential for induction of cell death and thereby may play a critical role in sepsis-induced endothelial cell injury.

Study reports the crystal structure of GSDMD C-terminal domain. Two interaction sites mediate the association of C and N domains. Mutations of GSDMD C-domain residues predicted to locate at its interface with the N-domain enhanced pyroptosis. Results suggest that GSDMDs may employ a distinct mode of intramolecular domain interaction and autoinhibition, which may be relevant to its unique role in pyroptosis.

The present study not only contributes to our understanding of GSDMD recognition by inflammatory caspases but also reports a specific inhibitor for these caspases that can serve as a tool for investigating inflammasome signaling.

Once inserted, the N-terminal domain of GSDMD assembles arc-, slit-, and ring-shaped oligomers, each of which being able to form transmembrane pores. This assembly and pore formation process is independent on whether GSDMD has been cleaved by caspase-1, caspase-4, or caspase-5.
High GSDMD expression is associated with tumor-node-metastasis in nonsmall cell lung cancer.

GSDMD is proteolytically activated by neutrophil proteases and, in turn, affects protease activation and nuclear expansion in a feed-forward loop. In addition to the central role of GSDMD in pyroptosis, we propose that GSDMD also plays an essential function in NETosis.

lncRNA RP185F18.6 and DeltaNp63 may be considered unfavorable biomarkers, whereas GSDMD may be a favorable biomarker in colorectal cancer (CRC) ; these markers may prove valuable in the future diagnosis and prognosis of CRC

T. vaginalis inflammasome activation induces macrophage inflammatory cell death by pyroptosis, known to occur via caspase-1 cleavage of the gasdermin D protein, which assembles to form pores in the host cell membrane. We found that T. vaginalis-induced cytolysis of macrophages is attenuated in gasdermin D knockout cells
role of GSDMD in the stretch-induced inflammatory response in human periodontal ligament cells
Shiga toxin 2 (Stx2)/Lipopolysaccharide complex, from pathogenic enterohemorrhagic Escherichia coli, activates caspase-4, gasdermin D (GSDMD), and the NLRP3 inflammasome in human THP-1 macrophages.
our current work demonstrates that IL-1beta release from stimulated THP1 cells is regulated by GSDM-D, and P2X7 is a dual-step process
findings suggest that NLRP3 is central to the activation/release of active caspase-1/GSDM-D encapsulated in microparticles (MP) by Francisella.

Our findings provide the first demonstration of GSDMD-determined pyroptotic cell death responsible for I/R induced release of IL-1beta and this would provide a mandate to better understand the unconventional mechanisms of cytokine release in the sterile innate immune system.
GSDMD is required for an optimal cytotoxic t-lymphocyte response to cancer cells
Gasdermin D: Evidence of pyroptosis in spontaneous preterm labor with sterile intra-amniotic inflammation or intra-amniotic infection.
alpha-NETA also significantly increased expression of pyroptosis-associated molecules including caspase-4 and GSDMD in epithelial ovarian cancer cells.
The GSDMD promotes IL-1 release from hyperactive or pyroptotic cells, with a specific focus on defining how these distinct cell fates associated with GSDMD activity can be regulated.
Gasdermin D (GSDMD) ontrols the release of the proinflammatory cytokines and pyroptotic cell death [Review].

The expression of gasdermin D N terminal domain was significantly increased in the liver during human acute liver failure (ALF), in a D-galactose/lipopolysaccharide (D-Galn/LPS)-induced ALF mouse model and in D-Galn/LPS-treated AML12 hepatocytes. GSDMD-mediated hepatocyte pyroptosis expanded the inflammatory response by upregulating MCP1/CCR2 to recruit macrophages.
Inactivation of the Cytoprotective Major Vault Protein by Caspase-1 and -9 in Epithelial Cells during Apoptosis.
Human polymorphisms in GSDMD alter the inflammatory response.
Structural Mechanism for GSDMD Targeting by Autoprocessed Caspases in Pyroptosis.
CD147 Expression Is Associated with Tumor Proliferation in Bladder Cancer via GSDMD.
High Glucose Induces the Loss of Retinal Pericytes Partly via NLRP3-Caspase-1-GSDMD-Mediated Pyroptosis.
Extended subsite profiling of the pyroptosis effector protein gasdermin D reveals a region recognized by inflammatory caspase-11.
Succination inactivates gasdermin D and blocks pyroptosis.
Rapamycin Inhibited Pyroptosis and Reduced the Release of IL-1beta and IL-18 in the Septic Response.
Zika virus protease induces caspase-independent pyroptotic cell death by directly cleaving gasdermin D.
Vitamin D/VDR attenuate cisplatin-induced AKI by down-regulating NLRP3/Caspase-1/GSDMD pyroptosis pathway.
Pyroptosis executive protein GSDMD as a biomarker for diagnosis and identification of Alzheimer's disease.
Involvement of TFAP2A in the activation of GSDMD gene promoter in hyperoxia-induced ALI.
Gasdermin D mediates the maturation and release of IL-1alpha downstream of inflammasomes.
Gasdermin D pore structure reveals preferential release of mature interleukin-1.
Control of gasdermin D oligomerization and pyroptosis by the Ragulator-Rag-mTORC1 pathway.
SARS-CoV-2 nucleocapsid suppresses host pyroptosis by blocking Gasdermin D cleavage.
Gasdermin D inhibition prevents multiple organ dysfunction during sepsis by blocking NET formation.
Association of serum Gasdermin D with anti-N-methyl-D-aspartate receptor encephalitis.
Pan-cancer analysis reveals the expression, genetic alteration and prognosis of pyroptosis key gene GSDMD.
Gasdermin D inhibition confers antineutrophil-mediated cardioprotection in acute myocardial infarction.
Establishment and validation of a gasdermin signature to evaluate the immune status and direct risk-group classification in luminal-B breast cancer.
GSDMD-mediated pyroptosis: a critical mechanism of diabetic nephropathy.
Gasdermin D pores are dynamically regulated by local phosphoinositide circuitry.
Electrostatic influence on IL-1 transport through the GSDMD pore.
Epithelial Gasdermin D shapes the host-microbial interface by driving mucus layer formation.
The colonic pathogen Entamoeba histolytica activates caspase-4/1 that cleaves the pore-forming protein gasdermin D to regulate IL-1beta secretion.
The macrophage-associated microRNA-4715-3p / Gasdermin D axis potentially indicates fibrosis progression in nonalcoholic fatty liver disease: evidence from transcriptome and biological data.
GSDMD-dependent pyroptotic induction by a multivalent CXCR4-targeted nanotoxin blocks colorectal cancer metastases.
New Insights Relating Gasdermin B to the Onset of Childhood Asthma.
Gasdermin D-mediated release of IL-33 from senescent hepatic stellate cells promotes obesity-associated hepatocellular carcinoma.
Translocation of gasdermin D induced mitochondrial injury and mitophagy mediated quality control in lipopolysaccharide related cardiomyocyte injury.
Macrophages promote growth, migration and epithelial-mesenchymal transition of renal cell carcinoma by regulating GSDMD/IL-1beta axis.
USP25 UPREGULATION BOOSTS GSDMD -MEDIATED PYROPTOSIS OF ACINAR CELLS IN ACUTE PANCREATITIS.
Hsa_circ_0012919 promotes pyroptosis in CD4+T cells of systemic lupus erythematous by miR-125a-3p/GSDMD axis.
Elevated circulating levels of gasdermin D are related to acute myocardial infarction and pyrogptosis.
The Mechanism of Osteoprotegerin-Induced Osteoclast Pyroptosis In Vitro.
Gasdermin D represses inflammation-induced colon cancer development by regulating apoptosis.
Oxidized mitochondrial DNA induces gasdermin D oligomerization in systemic lupus erythematosus.
Gasdermin-D activation promotes NLRP3 activation and host resistance to Leishmania infection.
GSDMD-mediated pyroptosis promotes cardiac remodeling in pressure overload.
The Role of Gasdermin-D-Mediated Pyroptosis in Organ Injury and Its Therapeutic Implications.
Copy number variation of gasdermin D gene is associated with atrial fibrillation-related thromboembolic stroke.
Gasdermin D-mediated pyroptosis: mechanisms, diseases, and inhibitors.
Gasdermin D Plays an Oncogenic Role in Glioma and Correlates to an Immunosuppressive Microenvironment.
Gasdermin D (GSDMD) Is Upregulated in Psoriatic Skin-A New Potential Link in the Pathogenesis of Psoriasis.
Expression and significance of effector proteins NLRP3 and gasdermin D N-terminal protein in the pyrolysis pathway in breast cancer.
Gasdermin D activation in oligodendrocytes and microglia drives inflammatory demyelination in progressive multiple sclerosis.
CHMP4B and VSP4A reverse GSDMD-mediated pyroptosis by cell membrane remodeling in endometrial carcinoma.
System analysis based on the pyroptosis-related genes identifes GSDMD as a novel therapy target for skin cutaneous melanoma.
O-GlcNAc modification of GSDMD attenuates LPS-induced endothelial cells pyroptosis.
[Expressions of NLRP3, Caspase-1, and GSDMD in nasopharyngeal carcinoma tissue and association with recurrence and metastasis].
Gasdermin D triggers cardiolipin-driven mitochondrial damage and pyroptosis.
GSDMD suppresses keratinocyte differentiation by inhibiting FLG expression and attenuating KCTD6-mediated HDAC1 degradation in atopic dermatitis.
Gasdermin D regulates soluble fms-like tyrosine kinase 1 release in macrophages.
TR4 worsen urosepsis by regulating GSDMD.
The palmitoylation of gasdermin D directs its membrane translocation and pore formation during pyroptosis.
A palmitoylation-depalmitoylation relay spatiotemporally controls GSDMD activation in pyroptosis.
Targeting STING elicits GSDMD-dependent pyroptosis and boosts anti-tumor immunity in renal cell carcinoma.
ROS-dependent S-palmitoylation activates cleaved and intact gasdermin D.

Gasdermin D deficiency aborts myeloid calcium influx to drive granulopoiesis in lupus nephritis.
Targeting BRD4 mitigates hepatocellular lipotoxicity by suppressing the NLRP3 inflammasome activation and GSDMD-mediated hepatocyte pyroptosis.
Palmitoylation at a conserved cysteine residue facilitates gasdermin D-mediated pyroptosis and cytokine release.

wikipathways.name: STING pathway in Kawasaki-like disease and COVID-19

summary: Gasdermin D is a member of the gasdermin family. Members of this family appear to play a role in regulation of epithelial proliferation. Gasdermin D has been suggested to act as a tumor suppressor. Alternatively spliced transcript variants have been described. [provided by RefSeq, Oct 2009].
